title: Mixed Reality-Based Medical Procedure Skill Acquisition: Arthroscopic Technique Training

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented training for current professionals. Mixed reality (MR)-based learning environment utilizing personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can accurately perform arthroscopic knot-tying procedures step-by-step in a mixed-reality environment.
Learners can explain and demonstrate procedural skills with over 80% accuracy after MR simulation.
Learners can analyze cognitive load factors and propose improvement strategies through formative assessment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
